articles.title: Circular issued by the Batroun Municipality
articles.summary: Batroun Municipality announces to all citizens and residents about fireworks and weddings
articles.content:
Batroun Municipality announces to all citizens and residents, especially those organizing parties and weddings, that:

It is strictly prohibited to launch fireworks after 10:30 PM,
in order to maintain the peace and safety of the residents.

We urge everyone to adhere to this decision,
as the municipality will be compelled to take legal action against violators
in order to preserve public order and safety.

articles.title: Sagesse basketball team in final
articles.summary: Sagesse basketball team win the 3rd game vs Beirut team
articles.content:
It was a huge and terrible game between sagesse and beirut
That have this scores:
End of the game
Beirut (77) - (78) Sagesse
End of Quarter 3
Beirut (53) - (61) Sagesse
End of Quarter 2
Beirut (33) - (40) Sagesse
End of Quarter 1
Beirut (12) - (16) Sagesse

With final score 77 - 78, sagesse will be in the final vs alriyadi team

articles.title: Horrific traffic accident on the Jbeil highway
articles.summary: A horrific traffic accident was recorded a short while ago on the Jbeil highway, heading west toward Beirut. Five cars collided, resulting in two injuries and extensive damage to all vehicles.
articles.content: The accident also caused heavy traffic in the area. Security forces are working to regulate traffic and open an investigation into the incident to take the necessary measures.

articles.title: Batroun Mini Football Villages 2025
articles.summary: The Youth Office of the Lebanese Forces Coordination Office in Batroun is honored to invite you to participate in the "Minifootball Villages" tournament for the summer of 2025.
articles.content:
The Youth Office of the Lebanese Forces Coordination Office in Batroun is honored to invite you to participate in the "Minifootball Villages" tournament for the summer of 2025. 
 Venue: Asia Sports Club. 
 Time: Starts August 3rd and ends August 23rd. 
 Age Group: Open. 
 Participation Fee: $100. 
 Prizes: $1,000 for first place, $300 for second place. 

 The draw will take place on the evening of July 25th at 6:00 PM at the Batroun Coordination Office. For registration or inquiries, call 79166033.

articles.title: The body of the Iraqi youth was found!
articles.summary: The body of the Iraqi youth who drowned yesterday off the coast of Batroun district was found.
articles.content: The body of a young man who had been missing since yesterday was found off the coast of Madfoun, Batroun, near a Lebanese Army checkpoint. Four people drowned yesterday. Civil Defense teams were able to rescue three of them at the time, while the search for the fourth person continues today. The body was found with the participation of Civil Defense teams and a number of local youth, in addition to the "JET SKI ARAKO" team in the area, who, along with Civil Defense personnel, contributed to the ongoing search until the body was found, according to the "Akhbar Al-Sa'a" website. The drowned man was identified as "A. A. H.", an Iraqi national born in 2006. The body was transferred to Batroun Hospital for necessary legal action.

articles.title: Musk call Lebanese President Aoun!
articles.summary: A call happened between Elon Musk and Lebanese President General Joseph Aoun in the afternoon
articles.content: Related to Musk wanting to visit Lebanon, and wanting to establish a connection between his companies and Lebanon, aiming to provide Lebanon with good internet access via Starlink

articles.summary: the last game between sagesse and beirut today at 10:00pm in beirut stadium, and on MTV Lebanon, also in all the restaurant in Batroun

articles.title: Is it possible to say Starlink Lebanon ?
articles.summary: Musk Starting his work to open a new branch for his company in Lebanon
articles.content: Lebanon is one of the places that Musk want to open a internet cells in it from long time, and this is the time to do it, that is what is sad from Mr Musk to Lebanese President Aoun

articles.title: Political Developments
articles.content: After a prolonged political deadlock, Lebanon achieved a significant milestone in January 2025 with the election of Joseph Aoun, the commander of the Lebanese Armed Forces, as president. Subsequently, Nawaf Salam, former judge at the International Court of Justice, was appointed Prime Minister. Their leadership is perceived as a move towards reducing Hezbollah's influence in Lebanese politics, especially following the group's setbacks in recent conflicts and regional shifts, such as the fall of the Assad regime in Syria.
